title: Pied-Noir
summary: The Pieds-Noirs (French pronunciation: ​[pje nwaʁ], 'Black Feet'), singular Pied-Noir, are the people of French and other European origin who were born in Algeria during the period of French rule from 1830 to 1962, the vast majority of whom departed for mainland France or Corsica as soon as Algeria gained independence, or in the months following.[3][4]
